attributes.action: THE RESULT OF THE EU REFERENDUM WAS INCONCLUSIVE & SHOULD BE IGNORED.
attributes.additional_details:
If this had been a standard parliamentary election, a 3.8% majority would not have led to a conclusive victory for one party.  Why should such a influential decision as this be any different?

Please sign.
attributes.background:
June 23rd 2016 was the day, we were given a monumental decision.  
Of the those eligible to vote, only 72.2% did.  Why should we give credibility to a vote won by a majority of 3.8%, that is less than 1.27 million votes and only represents 2.7% of the entire population.
